Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer's decision to reject the Applicant's claim for protection was reasonable
Evidence_Assessment: New evidence (death certificate, residency documents) was submitted but ignored or misinterpreted
Decision_Outcome: PRRA Officer rejected the Applicant's claim for protection
Burden_of_Proof: On the Applicant to demonstrate risk upon return
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's ethnicity (Tamil), past experiences of persecution, torture, and extortion
Legal_Rule: PRRA decisions are reviewed on a reasonableness standard; officer must consider all evidence and establish link to documented risks
Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly consider new evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution and torture based on ethnicity and prior targeting in Sri Lanka
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer failed to fairly assess submitted evidence
Applicant_Challenge: Decision ignored and misinterpreted key evidence
Court_Result: PRRA decision quashed, case remitted for re-determination
Legal_Provision: Sections of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act relating to PRRA
Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant, ethnic Tamil from Sri Lanka
